prospects.name: Introduction to SUF Strength Training
prospects.description: Want to start The Sufferfest Strength Training for cyclists? Watch this video before you do ANYTHING so you know what to expect and how the program works.

prospects.name: Run Focus 1
prospects.description:
The SYSTM Run Focus series of strength training sessions are designed specifically for runners to help improve performance and reduce the risk of injury. Each session offers a progressive set of integrated exercises that includes a focus on the lower body, posterior chain and core, in addition to supplementary movements for the upper body.

​

In this first routine in the sequence, we'll introduce you to some basic foundational movement patterns that will help improve your running by enhancing lower body and core stability as well as strength. The exercises are simple and the interval durations are short. Utilize the full duration of the session to focus on quality technique using the full range of motion. As the program progresses you'll complete more variations for longer periods, so dial in that good form now.

​

**Included Exercises:**

- Squat Wide Stance Hands Forward
- Single leg Hip Hinge
- Squat w/ Hands Behind Head
- Recoil Hamstring Stretch
- Kneeling Hip Drive Hands Up
- Kneeling Hips Side to Side
- Foot Circles
- Backward Lunge Arms on Hips
- Backward Shoulder Rolls
- Deep Squat w/Arms Crossed
- Single Leg Heel Raise
- Hip Hinge-Hands on Head
- Side Lunge to Knee Lift w/ Hold
- Frog Crunch
- Oblique Leg Lifts
- Bird Dog
- Pigeon Stretch
- Runner Stretch

prospects.name: Core & Hip Mobility A
prospects.description:
This module is a ground-based session designed to improve mobility through your hips and low back while activating and integrating muscles that are key to core stability. Take your time to work through the movements and focus on quality. Be sure to rotate through the other routines in this series on a regular basis for maximum benefit.

​

Exercises:

- Inchworm
- Pigeon Stretch
- Hip Bridge w/Knee Squeeze
- Marching Hip Bridge
- Back Extension w/Arms Overhead
- Quadruped w/Alt. Leg/Arm
- Bird Dog
- Kneeling Pelvic Tilt

prospects.name: Core Focus 01
prospects.description:
_Looking to improve ALL of the muscles that make up your core? You’ve come to the right place. The Core Focus series builds up everything from your hip to your shoulders - front, back, and side._

​

To do this, we’ll take you through a variety of contraction types: eccentric (lengthening), concentric (shortening), and isometric (holding a position). The result? Improved core strength, stability, and endurance. You'll find exercises that carry over into other areas of your body, but all of the moves have a significant impact on your core. Level 1 is ideal for very beginners. Even then, you may find some of these moves challenging if you have never attempted them. That’s ok, take your time and pause the video if you need. Soon you’ll be on your way to mastering your core potential. In addition to a mat, you'll need some open wall space for this routine.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you? [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Split Stance Side Bend w/ Arms Overhead
- Downward Dog
- Quadruped T-Spine Rotation
- Back Extension w/ opp arm & leg raise
- Hamstring Hip Bridge
- Oblique Leg Lifts
- Quadruped w/ alternating arm raise
- Quad w/ leg raises
- Low Side Plank w/ toe-tap front/back
- High Side Plank w/ Hold
- Quad Toes w/ Alternate Arm Raise
- Quadruped Pull In & Hold
- Quadruped Push Out & Hold
- Bird Dogs
- Back Extension with Hold
- Child's Pose

prospects.name: Foot & Ankle Mobility A
prospects.description:
This standing-based session is designed to improve mobility and flexibility through the foot, ankle, and calf. Take your time to work through the movements and focus on quality range of motion. We encourage you to take a little extra time on any exercises that you find challenging. Be sure to rotate through the other routines in this series on a regular basis for maximum benefit.

​

Exercises:

- Dynamic Calf Stretch
- Standing Ankle Dorsiflexion
- Single Leg Heel Raise

prospects.name: Dynamic Focus 01
prospects.description:
_Looking to improve your mobility, stability, power, and coordination? The Dynamic Focus series is a fun, unique, and valuable mix of balance, strength, and jumping exercises that develops your overall coordination and control._

​

As the first session in this progression, we introduce you to an integrated sequence of athletic movements. This mix may feel different and challenging..maybe even fun! Embrace it!

​

Please take your time, especially in this initial session. Start and stop the video to rewatch the demonstrations, if necessary, to ensure you understand the movement and grasp the range of motion. Finally, for the exercises that include a balance component, it will be ideal to keep your gaze fixed on a still object, not your screen.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you? [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Split Stance Backbend w/ Arms overhead
- Recoil Hamstring Stretch
- Around the clock Heel & Toe Taps
- Alternating-Step Under
- Split Stance Hip Hinges
- Low Skip In Place
- Single leg Hip Hinge
- Tip Toe Walk
- Deep Squat w/Arms Crossed
- Drop to Squat & Hold - Dbl. Leg
- Hop to Opposite Leg w/Hold
- Toe Touch

prospects.name: Foot & Ankle Recovery
prospects.description:
In this restorative sequence, the focus is on mobilizing the toes, feet, and ankles, stretching the calves and hamstrings, and opening up the hips. The session begins with a calming breathing technique, followed by a simple foot massage to introduce movement from the toes up to the heel. With increased range of motion, the routine progresses to gentle, dynamic stretches for the calves, hamstrings, and hips. Since feet are often neglected and subjected to high demands from activities like running or cycling, practicing this sequence at least once a week helps to rebalance and address this issue.

​

The objectives are to improve mobility in the feet and ankles, stretch the calves and hamstrings, and open up the hips.

​

**Poses in this session:**

- Easy Seat
- Box Breathing
- Foot Massage
- Downward Dog
- Screaming Toe
- Yoga Squat
- Ankle Stretch
- Ankle Mobilisations
- Windscreen Wipers

_Looking to improve ALL of the muscles that make up your core? You’ve come to the right place. The Core Focus series builds up everything from your hip to your shoulders - front, back, and side._

​

To do this, we’ll take you through a variety of contraction types: eccentric (lengthening), concentric (shortening), and isometric (holding a position). The result? Improved core strength, stability, and endurance. You'll find exercises that carry over into other areas of your body, but all of the moves have a significant impact on your core. - Quadruped Pull In & Hold

- Bird Dogs
- Back Extension with Hold
- Child's Pose

prospects.name: Recovery Booster
prospects.description: It may seem counterintuitive, but it's during recovery when you actually get stronger and consolidate the gains you've made while training. Without proper recovery, you won't improve. This session helps boost your recovery time, relaxing you and ensuring you give your body the chance to grow stronger.

prospects.name: Core & Hip Mobility C
prospects.description:
This module is a standing-based session designed to improve mobility through your hips, and challenge balance while activating and integrating muscles that are key to core stability. Take your time to work through the movements and focus on quality. Be sure to rotate through the other routines in this series on a regular basis for maximum benefit.

​

Exercises:

- Split Stance Back Bend
- Single-Leg Hip Hinge
- Split Stance Side Bend w/Arms Overhead
- Single-Leg Hip Hinge w/Rotation
- Downward Dog
- Pigeon Stretch

prospects.name: Dynamic Focus 02
prospects.description:
_Looking to improve your mobility, stability, power, and coordination? The Dynamic Focus series is a fun, unique, and valuable mix of balance, strength, and jumping exercises that_ _increase performance through stability, power, and coordination._

​

Now that you’ve completed Level 1, it’s time to add a layer of neuromuscular coordination. This sequence includes balance, unilateral drills, lower body strength, and jumping exercises - and combinations of those. You’ll even complete integrated exercises which involve single-leg challenges in various directions. Focus on controlled deliberate movements and solid landings to master this session.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you? [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Split Stance Backbend w/ Arms Overhead
- Around the Clock Heel & Toe Taps
- Step Unders
- Step Overs
- Recoil Hamstring Stretch
- Side Lunge to Knee Lift w/ Hold
- Split Stance Hip Hinges
- Single leg Hip Hinge
- Tip Toe Walk
- Deep Squat w/Arms Crossed
- Low Skip In Place
- Drop to Squat & Hold
- Single-Leg Hop forward-Backward-Hold
- Pogo Jumps
- Hop to Opp Leg w/Hold
- Double Leg Hop - Continuous - Square Pattern
- Pigeon Stretch
- Inchworm From Plank

prospects.name: Core & Hip Mobility D
prospects.description:
This standing-based session integrates adduction (towards your body midline) and abduction (away from your body midline) moves to improve stability through your hips and challenge balance while activating and integrating muscles that are key to core stability. Take your time to work through the movements and focus on quality. Be sure to rotate through the other routines in this series on a regular basis for maximum benefit.

​

Exercises:

- Split Stance Back Bend
- Standing Hip Abduction
- Single-Leg Hip Hinge
- Single-Leg Hip Bridge w/Rotation
- Pigeon Stretch

prospects.name: Run Focus 2
prospects.description:
The SYSTM Run Focus series of strength training sessions are designed specifically for runners to help improve performance and reduce the risk of injury. Each session offers a progressive set of integrated exercises that includes a focus on the lower body, posterior chain, and core, in addition to supplementary movements for the upper body.

​

In this second session, we'll build on the foundational movement patterns that you mastered in the previous routine. Run Focus 2 also includes new progressions to increase the number of activated muscle groups as well as some hopping moves to help challenge your hip and ankle stability.

​

**Included Exercises:**

- Squat Wide Stance Hands Forward
- Single leg Hip Hinge
- Squat w/ Hands Behind Head
- Recoil Hamstring Stretch
- Kneeling Hip Drive
- Kneeling Hips Side to Side
- Foot Circles
- Fire Hydrant
- Backward Lunge Arms on Hips
- Backward Shoulder Rolls
- Deep Squat w/Arms Crossed
- Single Leg Heel Raise
- Hip Hinge-Hands on Head
- Side Lunge to Knee Lift w/ Hold
- Tempo Hip Hinge
- Inchworm
- Hop to Opposite Leg w/Hold
- Frog Crunch
- Oblique Leg Lifts
- Back Extension w/ Arm & Leg raise
- Pigeon Stretch
- Runner Stretch

prospects.name: Improving Posture
prospects.description: Most cyclists suffer from rounded shoulders and a curved spine as a result of hours spent in the riding position. This series will release tension in your upper back and get you standing up straight and powerful again.

prospects.name: Dynamic Focus 03
prospects.description:
_Looking to improve your mobility, stability, power, and coordination? The Dynamic Focus series is a fun, unique, and valuable mix of balance, strength, and jumping exercises that_ _increase performance through stability, power, and coordination._

​

Ready for the third workout in the Dynamic Focus series? All athletes, including competitors in endurance sports, benefit from training that better helps you react to external factors in varying directions; people, wind, waves, inclines, and surfaces. This sequence will prime you for these variables with varying tempos. With a combination of exercises that integrate three-dimensional motion this session will keep your neuromuscular system primed and ready for anything, no matter what type of rubber you’re on.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you? [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Runners Stretch-Alternating
- Around the clock Heel & Toe Taps
- Recoil Hamstring Stretch
- Tip Toe Walk
- Deep Squat w/Arms Crossed
- Side Lunge to Knee Lift w/ Hold
- Single-Leg Hip Rotations
- Squat and Hold to Jump
- Backward Shoulder Rolls
- Low Skip In Place
- Tempo Squat
- Fast Side Lunge w/ Knee Lift
- Pogo Jumps
- Forward Shoulder Rolls
- Squat w/ Hands Behind Head
- Chin Tucks Reps
- Single-Leg Hop to Hold -Square Pattern
- Split Squats
- High Side Plank w/ rotation
- Pigeon Stretch

​

prospects.name: Shoulder & Upper Back Mobility A
prospects.description:
This session is designed to improve motion through your shoulders and upper back as well as activate muscles that are key for upper body stability and posture. Take your time to work through the movements and focus on quality range of motion. Do not move into pain. If you have tingling or numbness from any of these movements stop and consult a medical professional. Be sure to rotate through the other routines in this series on a regular basis for maximum benefit.

​

Exercises:

- Forward Shoulder Rolls
- Backward Shoulder Rolls
- Standing T-Spine Rotation
- Standing Scapular Retraction
- Wall Angels
- Scapular Depression
- Quadruped w/Alt. Arm Raise
- Quadruped w/Push Out
- Quadruped w/Pull In
- Downward Dog

prospects.name: Balance Training for Runners
prospects.description: Balance training is crucial to improve your running performance, and yoga is a fantastic way to hone your skills. In this sequence, we practice a number of one-legged standing, dynamic poses to improve your balance and proprioception (your sense of where your body is in space). These poses are also great for building strength and flexibility in the hips.

prospects.name: Hip Flexor and Groin Recovery
prospects.description: In this Beginner sequence, we release the hip flexors and groin and stretch the hamstrings and calves. It's a great session to do after a workout or in the evening to prevent and alleviate lower back pain.

prospects.name: Dynamic Focus 03
prospects.description:
_Looking to improve your mobility, stability, power, and coordination? The Dynamic Focus series is a fun, unique, and valuable mix of balance, strength, and jumping exercises that_ _increase performance through stability, power, and coordination._

prospects.name: Core & Hip Mobility E
prospects.description:
This module includes standing and floor-based exercises that integrate adduction, abduction, and rotation to challenge stability through your hips and core. These moves are certain to activate and integrate your three-dimensional trunk muscles which are key for core stability. Take your time to work through the movements and focus on quality. Be sure to rotate through the other routines in this series on a regular basis for maximum benefit.

​

Exercises:

- Standing Hip Abduction
- Single-Leg Hip Hinge w/Rotation
- Back Extensions
- Quadruped on Toes w/Alt. Arm Raise
- Oblique Leg Lifts w/Legs crossed
- Pigeon Stretch

prospects.description:
The SYSTM Run Focus series of strength training sessions are designed specifically for runners to help improve performance and reduce the risk of injury. Each session offers a progressive set of integrated exercises that includes a focus on the lower body, posterior chain, and core, in addition to supplementary movements for the upper body.

​

In this second session, we'll build on the foundational movement patterns that you mastered in the previous routine. Run Focus 2 also includes new progressions to increase the number of activated muscle groups as well as some hopping moves to help challenge your hip and ankle stability.

​

**Included Exercises:**

- Single leg Hip Hinge
- Squat w/ Hands Behind Head
- Recoil Hamstring Stretch
- Kneeling Hip Drive
- Kneeling Hips Side to Side
- Foot Circles

prospects.name: Core Strengtheners I
prospects.description: The power to to put watts to the pedals comes not just from your legs, but from your core. When your core is strong and stable, you can generate more power, more efficiently. You'll also suffer less back pain. With those goals in mind, this sequence strengthens the abs, obliques, and lower back.

prospects.name: Dynamic Focus 04
prospects.description:
_Looking to improve your mobility, stability, power, and coordination? The Dynamic Focus series is a fun, unique, and valuable mix of balance, strength, and jumping exercises that_ _increase performance through stability, power, and coordination._

​

The fourth sequence in this Dynamic Focus series challenges your neuromuscular coordination with longer intervals. Integrated exercises with balance, unilateral drills, lower body strength, and jumping are all present. With a focus on stability toward the second half of the session, you’ll be forced to control your motion when tired. Your concentration and endurance will be pushed to maintain quality execution the entire time.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you? [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Split Stance Backbend w/ Arms overhead
- Split Stance Hip Hinges
- Recoil Hamstring Stretch
- Step Unders
- Step Overs
- Single leg Hip Hinge
- Around the Clock Heel & Toe Taps
- Drop to Single-Leg Squat & Hold
- Tip Toe Walk
- Deep Squat w/Arms Crossed
- Tempo Squat
- Side Lunge to Knee Lift w/ Hold
- Single Leg Lateral Hop to Hold
- Drop to Single-Leg Squat & Hold
- Low Skip In Place
- Single-Leg Hop Forward-Backward-Hold
- Tempo Scissor Squat
- Runners Stretch

prospects.description:

- Single Leg Heel Raise
- Hip Hinge-Hands on Head
- Side Lunge to Knee Lift w/ Hold
- Tempo Hip Hinge
- Inchworm
- Hop to Opposite Leg w/Hold
- Frog Crunch
- Oblique Leg Lifts
- Back Extension w/ Arm & Leg raise
- Pigeon Stretch
- Runner Stretch

prospects.name: Balance and Core Control for Runners
prospects.description: This sequence is designed to improve your balance and core control, indispensable skills for all runners. We strengthen the abs, obliques, and hips, with a focus on moving slowly with control, dynamically between the postures.

prospects.name: Dynamic Focus 04
prospects.description:
_Looking to improve your mobility, stability, power, and coordination? The Dynamic Focus series is a fun, unique, and valuable mix of balance, strength, and jumping exercises that_ _increase performance through stability, power, and coordination._

​

The fourth sequence in this Dynamic Focus series challenges your neuromuscular coordination with longer intervals. Integrated exercises with balance, unilateral drills, lower body strength, and jumping are all present. With a focus on stability toward the second half of the session, you’ll be forced to control your motion when tired. Your concentration and endurance will be pushed to maintain quality execution the entire time.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you? [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Split Stance Backbend w/ Arms overhead
- Split Stance Hip Hinges
- Recoil Hamstring Stretch
- Step Unders
- Step Overs
- Single leg Hip Hinge
- Around the Clock Heel & Toe Taps
- Drop to Single-Leg Squat & Hold
- Tip Toe Walk
- Deep Squat w/Arms Crossed
- Tempo Squat
- Side Lunge to Knee Lift w/ Hold
- Single Leg Lateral Hop to Hold
- Drop to Single-Leg Squat & Hold
- Low Skip In Place
- Single-Leg Hop Forward-Backward-Hold
- Tempo Scissor Squat
- Runners Stretch

prospects.name: Run Focus 2
prospects.description:
The SYSTM Run Focus series of strength training sessions are designed specifically for runners to help improve performance and reduce the risk of injury. Each session offers a progressive set of integrated exercises that includes a focus on the lower body, posterior chain, and core, in addition to supplementary movements for the upper body.

​

In this second session, we'll build on the foundational movement patterns that you mastered in the previous routine. Run Focus 2 also includes new progressions to increase the number of activated muscle groups as well as some hopping moves to help challenge your hip and ankle stability.

​

**Included Exercises:**

- Squat Wide Stance Hands Forward
- Single leg Hip Hinge
- Squat w/ Hands Behind Head
- Recoil Hamstring Stretch
- Kneeling Hip Drive
- Kneeling Hips Side to Side
- Foot Circles
- Fire Hydrant
- Backward Lunge Arms on Hips
- Backward Shoulder Rolls
- Deep Squat w/Arms Crossed
- Single Leg Heel Raise
- Hip Hinge-Hands on Head
- Side Lunge to Knee Lift w/ Hold
- Tempo Hip Hinge
- Inchworm
- Hop to Opposite Leg w/Hold
- Frog Crunch
- Oblique Leg Lifts
- Back Extension w/ Arm & Leg raise
- Pigeon Stretch
- Runner Stretch

prospects.name: Core & Hip Mobility A
prospects.description:
This module is a ground-based session designed to improve mobility through your hips and low back while activating and integrating muscles that are key to core stability. Take your time to work through the movements and focus on quality. Be sure to rotate through the other routines in this series on a regular basis for maximum benefit.

​

Exercises:

- Inchworm
- Pigeon Stretch
- Hip Bridge w/Knee Squeeze
- Marching Hip Bridge
- Back Extension w/Arms Overhead
- Quadruped w/Alt. Leg/Arm
- Bird Dog
- Kneeling Pelvic Tilt

prospects.name: Foot & Ankle Recovery
prospects.description:
In this restorative sequence, the focus is on mobilizing the toes, feet, and ankles, stretching the calves and hamstrings, and opening up the hips. The session begins with a calming breathing technique, followed by a simple foot massage to introduce movement from the toes up to the heel. With increased range of motion, the routine progresses to gentle, dynamic stretches for the calves, hamstrings, and hips. Since feet are often neglected and subjected to high demands from activities like running or cycling, practicing this sequence at least once a week helps to rebalance and address this issue.

​

The objectives are to improve mobility in the feet and ankles, stretch the calves and hamstrings, and open up the hips.

​

**Poses in this session:**

- Easy Seat
- Box Breathing
- Foot Massage
- Downward Dog
- Screaming Toe
- Yoga Squat
- Ankle Stretch
- Ankle Mobilisations
- Windscreen Wipers

prospects.name: Recovery Session A
prospects.description:
These recovery sessions are easy enough that you get the rest you need, but work you hard enough that your body continues to adapt to the new demands you place on it. You might see these sessions as too short and too easy to be beneficial, but just like a proper recovery spin, active recovery is infinitely better than doing nothing at all. Given how short this session is, we strongly recommend also doing a Yoga Session in the app first. Something like Mobilize and Activate, Balance and Agility, or Full Body Mobilization.

​

**Exercises Included**

- Kneeling Hip Drive with Hands Up
- Kneeling Hip Drive with Hands to Side
- High Plank
- Plank
- Hip Bridge
- Bent Leg Tip at the Hip
- Standing Hip Drive with Hands Up
- Standing Hip Drive with Hands to Side
